job_title: Mental Health Counselor II in Pittsburgh, PA

review_title: Entry Level job, not a career
job_title: Residential Counselor II in McKeesport, PA
pros: Flexible scheduling, overtime. Good experience to work with chronic mental health and introduce yourself to group collaboration (therapists, psychiatrists, medical doctors, etc.). Good experience to build clinical writing skills.
cons: Poor management and no employee incentive. Sure, there's overtime, but there are no pay raises within this position, so whether you've been there 5 years or 2 months you all make the same amount. There is also a lack of care for employees. The place is a zoo, the residents have more rights than rules so attempting to get them to do what they need to is difficult.

pros: The actual work is fairly easy and they are very reasonable with scheduling, especially if you are a student.
cons: Upper management has lost its ethics, and become hostile towards good employees. Mostly this is fear of state regulations, but rather than look at the big picture, and make positive change,management finds it easier to take no action, and blame employees.

review_title: Great company to start but is going downhill

review_title: Unfortunately I was over worked and under paid. However, I learned a lot of new things to put on my resume.
